title: Ticket #3964: CORE and ERROR handling improvements in test infrastructure
description:
Before

What we did before was save the core file on log the test running when it occured. We did something similar with ERROR at the beginning og log statements after a time stamp. However it was vague if a core file or EOROR caused us to fail test.

Now

We still save the core files but have a build in limit(currently 10) set near the top of CondorTest.pm in $MAX_CORES. Once we see a core, we search all the daemon logs for the stack dump. We place this in the test output along with the c++filt output if that program exists. We also show part of our log of ERROR and CORE issues to stdout for the test.
